intro: Hoplophytum lingulatum, commonly known as the African ice plant, is a succulent species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, succulent stems and leaves. It produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Hoplophytum lingulatum is often used in rock gardens and as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
